page.title: 14SWINLEY PARK SAWMILL-WORKERS
page.content:
The{Sawmill}employs 25 full-time workers. Eleven men work in the mill itself and the rest work in the {forests.} There are seven woodmen who cut down the trees and the others check the trees for disease, maintain the fire rides, clear the ditches and thin the trees.
The{employees}who were interviewed said that they enjoyed working in the open air and had the advantage of low rent cottages on the estate and low cost firewood. The disadvantages were that the wages were not very high and the foresters were on duty at the weekends. One employee said that he had been employed on the{Crown Estates for 39 years, the last two years at the Sawmill. He worked a 39 hour week, from 7.00 a.m. until 5.30 p.m.
